name: SPCIoT
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
Welcome to the SPC IoT Smart Home! 
SPC Smart Home is a wide range of connected smart devices for your home. Control them from anywhere using a single app, SPC IoT, and make them interact with each other.
This new range of devices gives your home all the advantages of the Internet of things in a simple and accessible way. Connected homes in a connected world, forget about complicated installs and simplify your life in areas like security, comfort, as well as time and resource management.
Now, with the SPC IoT skill for Alexa, you can manage all of your SPC Smart Home smart devices. To start, press the "Enable" button in the Alexa App to link your SPC IoT account and say "Alexa, discover my devices." After installation, enjoy the advantages offered by Amazon Alexa voice commands and control your Smart devices. 
Lighting: 
-Alexa, turn on the living room lights
-Alexa, dim the kitchen light 
Comfort: 
-Alexa, turn on the robot vacuum cleaner 
-Alexa, turn on the fan in the room 
The possibilities are endless!
-Step-by-step guide for installing the Amazon skill: 
1. Download the SPC IoT application from Google Play or the iOS App Store, open it and log in.
2. Turn on the SPC Smart Home devices and synchronise them with the SPC IoT application. 
3. You can rename your SPC IoT devices using the application. For example, if you rename a smart bulb "Living-room Light", then Echo will learn the new name after searching for devices in "Step 9".
4. Download the Amazon Alexa app from Google Play or the iOS App Store, and connect Echo to the Alexa app. Then look for "SPC IoT" in the Alexa skills store.
5. Activate the "SPC IoT" skill, then enter your account user name, password and region on the linking page.
6. Say to Echo "Alexa, detect devices". Wait until Alexa confirms that it's found the devices. The setup is completed.
If you have installation questions, visit our new website's support area.
